sources.title: Black Robe (1991)
sources.description: Black Robe is a 1991 historical drama film directed by Bruce Beresford, adapted by Brian Moore from his 1985 novel of the same name. It  follows a Jesuit missionary, Father LaForgue, in 1634 New France  as he embarks on a perilous journey to establish a mission among the Huron people. Accompanied by Algonquin guides, he faces the challenges of the harsh wilderness and conflicts with rival tribes while grappling with cultural differences and the complexities of faith.

metadata.Plot: In the 17th century a Jesuit priest nicknamed Black Robe by the natives and his young companion are escorted through the wilderness of Quebec by a family of Algonquin Indians to find a distant mission in the dead of winter. Underneath the imposing and magnificent mountains, the Jesuit experiences a spiritual journey while his young companion falls in love with their Algonquin guide's beautiful daughter. Dread and death follows them upriver, however, as they face an Iroquois war party. Based on historical fiction novel.
metadata.Actors: Lothaire Bluteau, Aden Young, Sandrine Holt
